question.text: You are at a road junction, turning into a minor road. There are pedestrians crossing the minor road. You should

explanation.text: Always look into the road into which you are turning. If there are pedestrians crossing, give way to them, but don’t wave or signal to them to cross. Signal your intention to turn as you approach.

answer.text: stop and wave the pedestrians across
sound your horn to let the pedestrians know that you are there
give way to the pedestrians who are already crossing
carry on; the pedestrians should give way to you
